column1: ap 02:00|2|"Not all laws are logically the same. Consider
column3: the law shown in Figure 7. Dynamical Law 3 has two cycles. If you start on one of them
column4: you can’t get to the other. Nevertheless
column5: this law is completely deterministic. Wherever you start
column6: the future is determined. For example
column14: . . . and you will never get to 5. If you start at 5 the history is 5
column20: . . . and you will never get to 6."|"The Theoretical Minimum"|"Leonard Susskind"
